sect1.title: Achieving Multilib
sect1.para: On many distros, getting multilib support is very straight forward. There exists a guide that can act as a replacement for LFS: compiling and configuring a system that can boot, run, and compile software; and also have that same ability with 32-bit. It acts to form the basis that will allow you to follow any of the instructions laid out in the Steam and Wine chapters.
Such a guide is maintained by Thomas Trepl at . This only covers installing 32-bit support along with 64-bit. If you want x32-bit support, which is not needed for this book, follow .

The same principles of compiling for 32-bit in that book will also apply to this book as well. If you haven't already, read
to check what basic principles still apply in this book when targeting 32-bit.
Furthermore, read to find out which instructions to follow.
